courses.title: FUNDAMENTALS OF DATA STRUCTURES AND ALGORITHM
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: Designed for graduate students to provide them with the necessary background in data structures and algorithm analysis. Topics include: objects and abstract data types, dynamic variables and pointers, recursion, sort and search algorithms, linear and non-linear structures such as linked lists, trees and graphs, hashing, algorithms time complexity analysis, object-oriented design and programming. Graded S/U.

courses.title: COMPUTER ORGANIZATIONAL AND ASSEMBLY LANGUAGE FOR NON CS/CIS MAJOR
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: Computer organization and architecture including computer arithmetic, digital logic, assembly language, memory system organization, and computer interfacing. This course is a preparatory course for the Masters in Computer Science Program and has S/U grading.

courses.title: DISCRETE MATHEMATICS
courses.subject: MATH
courses.description: Sets, logic, induction, functions, relations, sequences, recursion, combinatorics, graphs and trees, matrices with an emphasis on applications in computer science.

courses.title: OPERATING SYSTEMS PRINCIPLES
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: An overview of the principles of operating systems. Topics include multiple processes, process synchronization and intercommunication, resource allocation, memory management, processor scheduling and I/O device management.

courses.title: DATABASE MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS I
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: Build theoretical foundation for database management systems, study different database models, relational algebra, relational calculus, SQL, ER, EER models, structured query formulations, database design, analysis and modeling, functional dependencies and normalization, and overview of next generation database management systems.

courses.title: ADVANCED DATA STRUCTURES AND ALGORITHM ANALYSIS
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: Data abstraction, linear data structures, file organization and access methods, memory management, advanced internal and external sort and search algorithms and the trade-offs involved in the use of different data organization.

courses.title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER I
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: Formal software engineering principles and practices and their application to the development of computer-based systems.

courses.title: COMPUTER NETWORKS
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: Computer networking concepts and technologies. Architectures and protocols, LANS, Internet working, and applications.

courses.title: COMPUTER SCIENCE GRAD PROJECT
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: Students conduct a study in an advanced computer-related topic or undertake the analysis, design and implementation of a real-world application. Graded S/U.

courses.title: COMPUTER SCIENCE THESIS
courses.subject: COSC
courses.description: An original investigation using an acceptable research method and design.
